title: Vegan Chickpea and Almond Sandwich Filling

ingredients.content: 100 g celery stalks, cut in 3 pieces
480 g cooked chickpeas, rinsed, drained (2 x 400 g tins)
1 ripe avocado, cut in pieces (3 cm)

preparations.content: Place almonds in mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to a large bowl.
Place celery, onions and dill in mixing bowl then chop <b>2 sec/speed 6<b>.
Add chickpeas and chop <b>1 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer to bowl with almonds.
Place avocado, lemon juice, nutritional yeast, garlic powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt and pepper in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Transfer to bowl with chickpea mixture then stir well with spatula to combine. Serve immediately in sandwiches, or cover with cling film and store in fridge for up to 3 days.

hintsAndTricks: While sometimes only a sandwich will do, it’s easy to get stuck in a rut of eating the same fillings. This creative, meat-free version uses roughly chopped chickpeas, crunchy almonds and red onion all held together in a smoky paprika dressing. Using creamy avocado instead of mayonnaise also makes it suitable for vegans.
Delicious served with the Mini Everything Bagels.
